body.p: First of all: Many thanks for your past and future contributions. Without those DownThemAll! wouldn't be such a successful addons and far less usable to a lot of people.

This is the new "landing page" designed to give babelzilla.org localizers a way to translate things that are not directly part of dTa, or at least not directly accessible from the normal user interface.
This page is divided into different sections:
The various sections contain some more descriptions. Texts will be taken from about.dtd and landingpage.dtd .
The following marks blocks to translate:

Important : If you change anything on this page after we release the next major version to the public then drop us a note in babelzilla about that. Else we migth miss to update those changes, as they won't be automatically packed into the extension.

The new landing page will be shown after initial installation and whenever a user upgrades a major release (e.g. 1.1 -> 1.2, but not 1.1.1 -> 1.1.2)
The landing page consists of a header and some "tabs". The header is always visible, while only one tab is visible at a time.

The real page is always accessible at about:downthemall .
We will try to regenerate the page on the server once you mark your localization either "testing" or "released" in the pre-release (beta) phase.
This version of the landing page elements will not be fully themed. Browse the about URL to get an idea what the final result will look like.

div.p: The context menu of a website offers a new DownThemAll! item. Using this item will show the DownThemAll! selection window, which you can use to easily select one or more links from a page.
In the selection window you have multiple ways to select which files to download:

ul.li: You may check the links you want to download by hand
You may use the build-in or own Filters, e.g. to download all linked images.
Additionally you may type in your own filter in the Fast filtering box.

div.p: The selection window contains to tabs, for two different types of downloads:

ol.li: The Links tab containing all downloadable links found on the page.
And the Pictures and Media tab containing all pictures and other media from the page.

div.p: Once you selected the files to download hit either Start! or Add paused.
